description:
Change of use and alterations to the Rotunda to provide
1 625 sq.m. of B1 use and Kendall's Hall to provide
residential accommodation in connection with the
redevelopments of the remainder of the site by the
erection of buildings to provide 85 self-contained
residential units  a retail unit  a health club and
nursery school accommodation and school playground as an
extension to New End Primary School  with a footpath
running through the site  all over an underground car
park providing 92 car parking spaces with a new
vehicular access onto New End as shown on drawing nos.
01A  45A  46B  47B  48B  49C  64B  65A  66  67E  68G
69E  100-108  109B -113B  114A  115A  116-118  119A  120
121  230A-236A  250A-252A  270A-275A  280A-285A  290A-
294A  295-298. revised on 12th May  9th September  1988
31st January  24th February  1989.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of all
    hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all
    unbuilt open areas, including the internal courtyard and
    the public footpath have been submitted to and approved by
    the Council.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    the end of the following planting season, with others of
    similar size and species, unless the Council gives written
    consent to any variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the
    permitted use of the development or any phase of the
    development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of
    planting which, within a period of 5 years from the
    completion of the development die, are removed, or become
    seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as
    is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than

Condition : 4 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from
    diseased during that period shall be replaced as soon as is
    reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the
    end of the following planting season, with trees of such
    size and species and in such positions as may be agreed
    with the Council, without prejudice to any further action
    the Council may consider appropriate to secure the
    protection of existing trees.
    adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as
    being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage
    to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least
    12 months following the completion of the development
    hereby approved, or such longer period as may be required
    under Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning
    Act 1990.  Any trees removed without the Council's consent
    or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously

Condition : 5 - Details of the design of building foundations and the
    layout, with dimensions and levels, of service trenches and
    other excavations on site in so far as these items may
    affect trees on or adjoining the site shall be submitted to
    and approved by the Council's Planning Transport and
    Employment Services before any works on site are commenced.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until full details of the
    number of spaces in and the layout of the car park and
    means of access thereto have been submitted to and approved
    by the Coucil.

Condition : 7 - A minimum of 85 of the spaces in the car park shall be
    retained permanently for the residential occupiers of the
    site.

Condition : 8 - No demolition or building operations shall take place on
    construction procedures together with vehicular
    activity.The developer shall comply with any Method of Work
    Statment so approved.
    site until the developer has submitted a Method of Work
    Statement to the Director of Planning and Transport for his
    written approval on behalf of the Coucil such approval not
    to be unreasonably delayed .(Before the developer submits
    the Method of Work Statement to the Director of Planning
    and Transport it shall have been discussed with a locally
    representative group including a Council Officer).The
    Method of Work Statement shall control demolition and

Condition : 9 - The footpath shall be provided and retained permanently for
    use by the general public, and its hours of operation shall
    be subject to an agreement between the developer and the
    Council.

Condition : 10 - Detailed plans shall be submitted to show that the building
    is so designed that it will comply with the Council`s
    standards in respect of noise levels in new residential
    developments, i.e. that the average 18 hour L10 noise level
    within habitable rooms shall not exceed 45dBA. details of
    the proposed development.

Condition : 11 - The whole of the proposed development shall be completed
    and available for occupation in accordance with a timescale
    to be agreed with the Council.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 13 - 05and06.In order that the Council may give consideration to
    the details of the proposed development.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard
    of visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area.

Condition : 16 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 17 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 18 - To ensure that the development is completed and used as
    permitted.

Condition : 19 - In order to ensure that the new development is adequately
    protected against the penetration of noise.

Condition : 20 - In order to ensure that the development is completed and
    occupied as permitted. connections to sewers.

Condition : 21 - The Council's Engineering Services should be consulted
    regarding the construction of the crossover on the public
    highway and any other work to, under, or over the public
    highway, including vaults and thresholds. The Section
    dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ (071-278
    4444).

Condition : 22 - Your attention is drawn to the requirements of Sections 4,
    7, and 8A of the Chronically Sick & Disabled Persons Act
    1970 that this development (for employment use or to which
    the public will be admitted) should be made accessible to
    disabled people wherever practicable. Guidance is provided
    in British Standards Institution Code of Practice BS 5588
    1987 "Access for the Disabled to Buildings".

Condition : 23 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 24 - Your attention is drawn to the need to consult the
    Council's Engineering & Consumer Protection Service, Waste
    Management Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street entrance, Euston
    Road, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 071-278 4444), regarding arrangements
    for the disposal of refuse. 05The developer is asked to
    contact the Council`s Chief Engineer regarding

Condition : 25 - The enclosed leaflet sets out the Council's guidelines for
    the protection of trees on development sites.
